hero_section.title: Begin Your Spiritual Journey
hero_section.description: Discover daily prayers, Azkar, and spiritual guidance from the Quran and Sunnah

cards.title: Daily Prayers
cards.description: Find prayer times and guidance for your location

cards.title: Morning Azkar
cards.description: Start your day with blessed morning remembrance

cards.title: Evening Azkar
cards.description: End your day with peaceful evening remembrance

guides.title: 1. Purification (Wudu)
guides.about: Before you pray, it’s important to be in a state of physical and spiritual purity. This means doing wudu, or ablution. It involves washing your hands, mouth, nose, face, arms, head, and feet in a specific order. It’s a refreshing way to prepare yourself for prayer.

guides.title: 2. Intention (Niyyah)
guides.about: Think about your intention in your heart. You don’t need to say it out loud, but remind yourself that you are praying for Allah’s sake. This simple act of setting your intention can enhance your focus during the prayer.

guides.title: 3. Choose a Clean Space
guides.about: Find a clean and quiet place to pray where you won’t be distracted. This could be a designated prayer area in your home, a quiet room, or even a corner of your office.

guides.title: 4. Dress Modestly
guides.about: Wear clean and modest clothing. For men, this means covering from the navel to the knees. Women should wear loose-fitting clothes that cover their bodies.

guides.title: 5. Step-by-Step Guide to Performing Solat
steps: Begin the Prayer with Takbir al-Ihram.
Recite Another Surah or Verses from the Quran.

guides.title: 5.1. Stand Facing the Qibla
steps: Use compass or Qibla Finder Web App.
Start positioning yourself to the Qibla.

guides.title: 5.2. Begin the Prayer with Takbir al-Ihram
steps: Raise your hands to your ears (or shoulders).

guides.title: 5.3. Recite Surah Al-Fatiha
steps: Recite Surah Al-Fatiha (The opening chapter of the Quran.)

guides.title: 5.4. Recite Another Surah or Verses from the Quran
5.5. Perform the Ruku (Bowing)
steps: Bend at the waist with your hands on your knees.

steps.step: While in this position, say this 3 times "Subhana Rabbiyal Adheemi Wa Bihamdihi"
description: Meaning: (Glory is to my Lord, the Most Great)

steps.step: Then say "Sami’ Allahu liman Hamidah, Rabbana wa laka al-hamd"
description: Meaning: (Allah hears the one who praises Him; Our Lord, to You belongs all praise)

steps.step: Touching your forehead, nose, palms, knees, and toes to the floor
description: In this position, say "Subhana Rabbiyal A’la Wa Bihamdihi" 3 times
Meaning (Glory is to my Lord, the Most High)

steps.step: Sit on your legs and say
description: "Rabbighfir li War Hamni Wajburni War Fa’ni War Zuqni Wa Ihdini Wa ‘Aafini Wa’fu ‘Anni"
Meaning: (O Lord, forgive me, have mercy on me, support me, elevate me, provide for me, guide me, grant me health, and pardon me)

steps.step: Repeat "Subhana Rabbiyal A’la Wa Bihamdihi" 3 times
description: Meaning (Glory is to my Lord, the Most High)

guides.title: 5.10. Complete the Rak’ah
steps: Rise again to a standing position to complete the Rak’ah
If you’re praying a prayer with more than one Rak’ah.
Repeat 3-9 steps for each additional Rak’ah.

guides.title: 5.11. Concluding the Prayer
steps: After finishing the required number of Rak’ahs.

steps.step: Sit for the Tashahhud (testimony) and recite:
description: At-tahiyyatu lillahi was-salawatu wat-tayyibat. As-salamu ‘alayka ayyuhan-nabi, wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh. As-salamu ‘alayna wa ‘ala ibadillahis-salihin. Ashhadu an la ilaha illa Allah, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadur Rasoolullah.

Meaning: (All greetings, prayers, and good things are for Allah. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah. I bear witness that there is no deity except Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.)

steps.step: Turn your head to the right and then to the left, saying this in each direction
description: Meaning: (Peace and mercy of Allah be upon you)

events.title: Beginning of Ramadan
events.description: The holy month of fasting begins
events.event: The blessed month of fasting, increased worship, and spiritual reflection

events.title: Laylat al-Qadr
events.description: A special night that is repeated every Hijri year in the month of Ramadan
events.event: Laylat al-Qadr is the night on which livelihoods are determined

events.title: Eid al-Fitr
events.event: Celebration marking the end of Ramadan and fasting
Commemorating Prophet Ibrahim’s willingness to sacrifice his son

events.title: Islamic New Year
events.event: Marks the migration of Prophet Muhammad (Peace been upon him) from Makkah to Madinah

events.title: Mawlid al-Nabi
events.description: Birth of Prophet Muhammad (Peace been upon him)
events.event: Commemorating the birth of the final Prophet (Peace been upon him)
